img.title: Family Assistance
img.br:
This resource page includes free services being offered during the coronavirus pandemic.
If your family needs specific support, please contact one of our District Social Workers:
Joelle Jones, Elementary Social Worker: jjones@raiderweb.org
Amy McPhilemy, Secondary Social Worker: amcphilemy@raiderweb.org
Jodi Sessa, Home & Family Visitor: jsessa@raiderweb.org

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-family: Tahoma, Verdana, Arial, Helvetica; font-size: 24px; color: rgb(47, 132, 107);

hr.p: For free internet access from Comcast, go to our Remote Learning Technology page.

hr.span: KEEPING YOUR DISTANCE TO STAY SAFE

br.span: TIPS FOR SOCIAL DISTANCING, QUARANTINE, AND ISOLATION

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-family: Tahoma, Verdana, Arial, Helvetica; font-size: 24px; color: rgb(47, 132, 107);

hr.p: If you are struggling to pay your utility bills, contact your service provider right away. Many utility providers offer emergency assistance programs at this time.
hr.a: Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program (LIHEAP)
hr.br:
1-866-452-6152
unemployment Unemployment Benefits
housing HEALTH, FOOD, HOUSING AND HUMAN SERVICES
Easy access to customized health, housing, and human services information in one place.
717-652-4400 or 211
http://www.contacthelpline.org
HOMELESSNESS SHELTER OR DISPLACEMENT RESOURCES
HELP attempts to find short term, emergency shelter for those low-income individuals in need of housing. People who are faced with an eviction, and who fall into the category of being threatened by homelessness, can get crisis assistance too, such as emergency rent payments or deposits.
717-238-2851 - After hours contact 717-232-7511.
413 South 19th Street
Harrisburg, PA 17104
http://www.ccuhbg.org/
